context: That been the boundes of West Lumbardie
That was his sone,° in his right hand, and fledde;
¶“My righte° lady,” quod this Jasoun tho
“The righte° lady of my lif,” quod° he
“My righte° doghter, tresor° of min herte!
This is the righte lif that I am inne
First he gan hir his right lady calle
‘Brother,’ quod he, ‘fer in the north contree
The bountee of his righte lady dere
¶“My righte° lady,” quod this woful man
Thy righte place is now no lenger here!
Ther is, at the west side of Itaille
In this array the righte wey han holde.
So noble array in al West Lumbardie.
But he noot° which the righte wey is thider;
A citole° in hir right hand hadde she
And hoom wente every man the righte way.
Upon the right hond wente old Egeus
Upon the left hand, with a loud shoutinge
And Custance han ytake the righte way
To Engelond been they come the righte wey
That ye han sworn with your right honde
The castel-yate° on my right hond
“Who seeth yow now, my righte lodesterre?
Me caughte first my righte lady dere.
Whan hennes rood my righte lady dere
For love of God, my righte lodesterre
And at the west gate of the toun,’ quod he
Unto the west gate of the toun, and fond
